mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Bushrod Washington to Julia Ann Blackburn Washington, 1809 April 24
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Bushrod, 1762-1829
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Bushrod Washington writes from Philadelphia, expresses his happiness that her health has improved, apparently due to the efficacy of a medicinal concoction of his own devise. Describes his heavy work schedule of Supreme Court cases and a visit to a circus, which he enjoyed immensely. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medicine--History--18th century
